titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Middleton, James Blevins, Ransom Blevins, E. D. Bailey, Benjamin Middleton, William Eldridge, David Middleton, Carr Eldridge, & James Eldridge, Indictment
CWG5354

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Harlan Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Agst } Indictment
William Middleton James Blevins Ransom Blevins E D Bailey Benjamin Middleton William Eldridge David Middleton Carr Eldridge & James Eldridge. The grand Jury of Harlan County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse William Middleton James Blevins Ransom Blevins E D Bailey Benjamin Middleton Wm Eldridge David Middleton Carr Eldridge & James Eldridge of the Crime of Robbery Committed as follows viz

The said aforesaid persons did in the county aforesaid on the 26th day of Sept 1865 Feloniously forceably & by puting Wright Kelly & others in fear of some immediate Injury to his person take from said Kelly one Beaver coat 12 tin cups one pistol one web of cloth & other items to tedious to mention all of the value of fifty Dollars against the peace & dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

wit
Mary Sergent Aubry Gilbert
Sarah Smith
Thomas
S R Gilbert Polly Thomas
Elizabeth Kelly
A copy attest J K Bailey C H C C
Pardon
